definition: bullheadedness/stubborn
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
surname Niu
spleen
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Liu said he was bullish temperament big, pregnant than dragon laughed.
sentences.chinese: 劉說他牛脾氣大，懷過龍笑了。
他只不過是在耍牛脾氣。

sentences.english: It's when change upsets the routine that our Bull's temper can flare.
sentences.chinese: 改變破壞常規時，金牛座可能會發起牛脾氣。

definition: having nothing better to do
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
foolish talk/nonsense
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
female gossip/busybody
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: conventional greeting/polite formula
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4
